allowance(address,address).details: Returns the remaining number of tokens that `spender` will be allowed to spend on behalf of `owner` through {transferFrom}. This is zero by default. This value changes when {approve} or {transferFrom} are called.

approve(address,uint256).details: This function will check if the owner has sufficient funds to allow others to spend them and it emits a {Approval} event.

params._spender: The user you're allowing to spend your tokens on your behalf
params._value: The amount of tokens you're allowing to be spent on your behalf

returns.success: A boolean that indicates if the approval was successful or not

balanceOf(address).details: Returns the value of the {_balanceOf} mapping for the provided account address

params.account: The address whose token balance needs to be queried

returns.amount: The number of tokens owned by the provided account

returns.success: A boolean indicating whether the operation succeeded
Boolean indicating whether the claim was successful

params._spender: The address which will spend the funds
params._subtractedValue: The amount to decrease the allowance by

returns.success: A boolean indicating whether the operation succeeded

returns._0: The faucet amount in token units
Whether the address has claimed from the faucet

params._addedValue: The amount to increase the allowance by
params._spender: The address which will spend the funds

returns.success: A boolean indicating whether the operation succeeded

params._to: Address that will receive the minted tokens

returns.success: A boolean indicating whether the operation succeeded

returns.supply: The current total amount of tokens

transfer(address,uint256).details: This function follows the ERC-20 standard and emits a {Transfer} event.      Ensure `_to` is not the zero address.

params._value: The amount of tokens to transfer.

returns.success: A boolean indicating whether the transfer was successful.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Moves a `value` amount of tokens from `from` to `to` using the allowance mechanism. `value` is then deducted from the caller's allowance. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. Emits a {Transfer} event.

params._newOwner: The address of the new owner

approve(address,uint256).notice: Approve other users to spend your tokens on your behalf. Use it carefully!!

balanceOf(address).notice: This method returns the amount of tokens owned by a address

burn(uint256).notice: Destroys tokens from the caller's account, reducing total supply

cap().notice: Returns the maximum possible token supply

claimFaucet().notice: Allows users to claim a preset amount of tokens once per address

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: Decrease the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller

faucetAmount().notice: Returns the amount of tokens a user can claim from the faucet

hasClaimedFaucet(address).notice: Checks if an address has already claimed from the faucet

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: Increase the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller

mint(address,uint256).notice: Creates new tokens and assigns them to the specified address

owner().notice: Returns the current owner of the contract

pause().notice: Pauses all token transfers, to be used in emergency situations

paused().notice: Checks if the contract is currently paused

totalSupply().notice: This method tells the current total supply of tokens

transfer(address,uint256).notice: Transfers tokens from your account to another user.

transferOwnership(address).notice: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account
